hexagrams.judgment: Enthusiasm. It furthers one to install helpers and to set armies marching.
hexagrams.image: Thunder comes resounding out of the earth: the image of Enthusiasm. Thus the ancient kings made music in order to honor merit, and offered it with splendor to the Supreme Deity, inviting their ancestors to be present.

lines.line_1: Enthusiasm that expresses itself brings misfortune.
lines.line_2: Firm as a rock. Not a whole day. Perseverance brings good fortune.
lines.line_3: Enthusiasm that looks upward creates remorse. Hesitation brings remorse.
lines.line_4: The source of enthusiasm. He achieves great things. Doubt not. You gather friends around you as a hair clasp gathers the hair.
lines.line_5: Persistently ill, and still does not die.
lines.line_6: Deluded enthusiasm. But if after completion one changes, there is no blame.

hexagrams.judgment: Following has supreme success. Perseverance furthers. No blame.
hexagrams.image: Thunder in the middle of the lake: the image of Following. Thus the superior man at nightfall goes indoors for rest and recuperation.

lines.line_1: The standard is changing. Perseverance brings good fortune. To go out of the door in company produces deeds.
lines.line_2: If one clings to the little boy, one loses the strong man.
lines.line_3: If one clings to the strong man, one loses the little boy. Through following one finds what one seeks. It furthers one to remain persevering.
lines.line_4: Following creates success. Perseverance brings misfortune. To go one's way with sincerity brings clarity. How could there be blame in this?
lines.line_5: Sincere in the good. Good fortune.
lines.line_6: He meets with firm allegiance and is still further bound. The king introduces him to the Western Mountain.

hexagrams.affirmation: I follow with perseverance and adaptability.

hexagrams.hexagram_name: Work on What Has Been Spoiled
hexagrams.judgment: Work on What Has Been Spoiled has supreme success. It furthers one to cross the great water. Before the starting point, three days. After the starting point, three days.
hexagrams.image: The wind blows low on the mountain: the image of Decay. Thus the superior man stirs up the people and strengthens their spirit.

lines.line_1: Setting right what has been spoiled by the father. If there is a son, no blame rests upon the departed father. Danger. In the end, good fortune.
lines.line_2: Setting right what has been spoiled by the mother. One must not be too persevering.
lines.line_3: Setting right what has been spoiled by the father. There will be little remorse. No great blame.
lines.line_4: Tolerating what has been spoiled by the father. In continuing one sees humiliation.
lines.line_5: Setting right what has been spoiled by the father. One meets with praise.
lines.line_6: He does not serve kings and princes, sets himself higher goals.

hexagrams.affirmation: I restore and renew with perseverance.

hexagrams.judgment: Approach has supreme success. Perseverance furthers. When the eighth month comes, there will be misfortune.
hexagrams.image: The earth above the lake: the image of Approach. Thus the superior man is inexhaustible in his will to teach, and without limits in his tolerance and protection of the people.

lines.line_1: Joint approach. Perseverance brings good fortune.
lines.line_2: Joint approach. Good fortune. Everything furthers.
lines.line_3: Comfortable approach. Nothing that would further. If one is induced to grieve over it, one becomes free of blame.
lines.line_5: Wise approach. This is right for a great prince. Good fortune.
lines.line_6: Approach with good intentions. Supreme good fortune. No blame.

hexagrams.affirmation: I approach with success and perseverance.

hexagrams.judgment: Contemplation. The ablution has been made, but not yet the offering. Full of trust they look up to him.
hexagrams.image: The wind blows over the earth: the image of Contemplation. Thus the kings of old visited the regions of the world, contemplated the people, and gave them instruction.

lines.line_1: Boylike contemplation. For an inferior man, no blame. For a superior man, humiliation.
lines.line_2: Contemplation through the crack of the door. Furthering for the perseverance of a woman.
lines.line_3: Contemplation of my life decides the choice between advance and retreat.
lines.line_4: Contemplation of the light of the kingdom. It furthers one to exert influence as the guest of a king.
lines.line_5: Contemplation of my life. The superior man is without blame.
lines.line_6: Contemplation of his life. The superior man is without blame.

hexagrams.affirmation: I contemplate with reflection and insight.
